      java.lang.String getBattleState()
      checks if the number of active rebels is zero; checks if the number of weapons existent in the game is zero; if one of those conditions is true, it set the battleState has "OVER"; if the game has already started, it set the battleState has "ON";

      int getCoorCount(java.lang.String name)
      goes to a rebel and says how many steps has taken;

      says what is the state of a rebel;
      java.lang.String getStormtrooperState(java.lang.String Identifier)
      says what is the state of a stormtrooper;
      int getTotalPoints()
      goes through the rebels array and check how many points every rebel has and add it to a local variable;
      boolean hasRogueOne()
      checks if there is already a defined map or not; depending on the case it will show a different answer;
      boolean hasSetup()
      compares the string in the variable battleState with the string "SETUP"; if they are the same it will return "true"; otherwise it will return "false";
      boolean hasStarted()
      checks the switch of the variable start; depending on its switch, the method will return a different value;
      boolean hasStormtrooper(java.lang.String Identifier)
      goes through the stormtrooper's array, and compares the Identifier of stormtrooper with the param Identifier; if they are the same it switch the local variable to "true"; if not it will keep it as "false";
      boolean hasValidPos(int row, int col)
      checks if the position, in the map, is occupied by a blank space; if yes, it will return "true"; if not it will return "false";
      Iterator<Coordenates> jediPath(java.lang.String name)
      it will iterate the number of steps and where, the rebel has been;
      Iterator<Rebels> jediSetting()
      it will iterate all the rebels;
      void move(java.lang.String[] array)
      goes through the rebel's array; if the rebels was captured it moves to the next one; oldRow is the current row of the rebel; oldCol is the current column of the rebel; row contains the future row position of rebel; col contains the future column position of rebel; if the rebel reached the map's limits, found a wall or another rebel, it won't move; checks if in the future position there is a rebel; checks if in the future position has potion; checks if in the future position has gun; the last one moves to a blank space;
      void moveStormtrooper()
      goes through the stormtrooper's array; if the stormtrooper was captured it moves to the next one; calls the method actionMovement(i); the i is the position of one stormtrooper in the stormtrooper's array;
      void newRebel(java.lang.String name, int row, int col)
      it creates a new rebel by adding him to the rebel's array; it will also put the character "R" in the inserted position;
      void nextRound()
      goes through the rebel's array; if a rebel is awakened, it will decrease the number of times, he can stil remained in that state; if the value reached zero it will change the character in the current rebel to an "R"; increments the value o rounds by one;
      int numOfActiveRebels() 
      int numOfActiveStormtroopers() 
      int numOfCapturedRebels(java.lang.String Identifier)
      checks how many rebels, a stormtrooper has already captured;
      int numOfRebels() 
      int numOfStormtroopers() 
      void reset()
      it will put every variable ou array to its default value, so then the user can start the game again;
      void rogueOne(char[][] array, int row, int col)
      it will create the array of objects, called map through the param array; it will also goes through the array map, to see if there are stormtrooper; if there are they will be added to the stromtrooper's array; finally it will goes through the param array to count how many weapons there are in the whole map;
      Iterator<Stormtrooper> sithSetting()
      it will iterate all the stormtrooper;
      void startBattle()
      it switches the boolean start to "true";
      boolean twoJedis(java.lang.String name)
      goes through the rebel's array and check there is a rebel with the same as the param name; if yes it will switch the local variable to "true"; if not it will keep it as "false";

    • Method Detail

      • rogueOne

        void rogueOne(char[][] array,
              int row,
              int col)
        it will create the array of objects, called map through the param array; it will also goes through the array map, to see if there are stormtrooper; if there are they will be added to the stromtrooper's array; finally it will goes through the param array to count how many weapons there are in the whole map;
        Parameters:
        array - contains the characters that will the object for the maze;
        row - the max number of rows;
        col - the max number of columns;

      • newRebel

        void newRebel(java.lang.String name,
              int row,
              int col)
        it creates a new rebel by adding him to the rebel's array; it will also put the character "R" in the inserted position;
        Parameters:
        name - name of the rebel;
        row - row position you will put the rebel;
        col - column position you will put the rebel;

      • startBattle

        void startBattle()
        it switches the boolean start to "true";

      • move

        void move(java.lang.String[] array)
        goes through the rebel's array; if the rebels was captured it moves to the next one; oldRow is the current row of the rebel; oldCol is the current column of the rebel; row contains the future row position of rebel; col contains the future column position of rebel; if the rebel reached the map's limits, found a wall or another rebel, it won't move; checks if in the future position there is a rebel; checks if in the future position has potion; checks if in the future position has gun; the last one moves to a blank space;
        Parameters:
        array - Contains the future directions of the rebels;

      • moveStormtrooper

        void moveStormtrooper()
        goes through the stormtrooper's array; if the stormtrooper was captured it moves to the next one; calls the method actionMovement(i); the i is the position of one stormtrooper in the stormtrooper's array;

      • nextRound

        void nextRound()
        goes through the rebel's array; if a rebel is awakened, it will decrease the number of times, he can stil remained in that state; if the value reached zero it will change the character in the current rebel to an "R"; increments the value o rounds by one;

      • reset

        void reset()
        it will put every variable ou array to its default value, so then the user can start the game again;

        java.lang.String getBattleState()
